headline: Hospital Chains’ Medicaid Profits Are a Juicy Target for GOP Budget Hawks
summary: Universal Health Services  has a billionaire controlling shareholder and a lucrative Medicaid cash stream.  Last year 68% of UHS’s pretax income came from government outlays commonly known as supplemental Medicaid payment programs, including so-called state-directed payments.  In essence, both the company and Wall Street are making a bullish call on federal spending at a time when congressional Republicans and the Trump administration are pushing austerity.
